item.title: Neonatal early onset sepsis (EOS), bacterial infection during the first 7 days of life, is difficult to diagnose because presenting signs are non-specific, but early diagnosis before birth can direct life-saving treatment for mother and baby.
item.description: Neonatal early onset sepsis (EOS), bacterial infection during the first 7 days of life, is difficult to diagnose because presenting signs are non-specific, but early diagnosis before birth can direct life-saving treatment for mother and baby.
item.content:encoded: Neonatal early onset sepsis (EOS), bacterial infection during the first 7 days of life, is difficult to diagnose because presenting signs are non-specific, but early diagnosis before birth can direct life-saving treatment for mother and baby.

item.title: Specifically, maternal fever during labor from placental infection is the strongest predictor of EOS. Using such a predictive model could identify hours in advance mothers at risk for fever and infants at risk of EOS, guiding maternal antibiotic prophylaxis & neonatal monitoring.
